project.title: Teachable Machine
project.excerpt: Teachable Machine is an experiment that lets anyone explore how machine learning works, in a fun, hands-on way. You can teach a machine to using your camera, live in the browser – no coding required.
project.content:
Teachable Machine is an experiment that lets anyone explore how machine learning works, in a fun, hands-on way. You can teach a machine to using your camera, live in the browser – no coding required. Try it out for yourself at https://teachablemachine.withgoogle.com/v1

The image recognition is powered by a neural network. It uses the open-source library tensorflow.js, which allows web developers to run machine learning models locally in the browser. The experiment is open-sourced on Github.

I helped prototype and build Teachable Machine along with Lasse Korsgaard in our former company Støj in 2017. We made this experiment together with Use All Five, Google PAIR and Google Creative Lab.
